meanings.def: a business project or activity, especially one that involves taking risks
examples: A disastrous business venture lost him thousands of dollars.
The directors of the company refused to undertake such a risky venture.
a cooperative venture by companies at the science park

meanings.def: to go somewhere even though you know that it might be dangerous or unpleasant
examples: They ventured nervously into the water.
He's never ventured abroad in his life.
A few people ventured out into the street.
He ventured deeper into the forest.
She ventured cautiously into the room.
She would not have dared venture here alone.
Some of the men ventured farther out to sea.
They never ventured from their buildings after sunset.
They rarely ventured beyond their local market town.
We ventured down to the south coast over the weekend.

meanings.def: to say or do something in a careful way, especially because it might upset or offend somebody
examples: venture something She hardly dared to venture an opinion.
venture to do something I ventured to suggest that she might have made a mistake.
+ speech ‘And if I say no?’ she ventured.
venture that… He ventured that the data might be flawed.

meanings.def: to risk losing something valuable or important if you are not successful at something
examples: It was wrong to venture his financial security on such a risky deal.

meanings.def: used to say that you have to take risks if you want to achieve things and be successful

idioms.def: used to say that you have to take risks if you want to achieve things and be successful
